result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James E. Pettis Jr.

records.addlTxt: 9:59 AM cases 22CF708, 22CF732, 22CF892, 22CF914, 22CT321 called. Defendant James E. Pettis Jr. in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for James E. Pettis Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. There is no offer at this time. A return hearing is scheduled for 12/12/22 at 9:30 am.

9:39 AM 22CF708, 22CF732, 22CF914, 22CF892 & 22CT321. Defendant James E. Pettis Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for James E. Pettis Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rivard has not been appointed on all files yet.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/12/22 at 1:15pm
Hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with K.W.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
